gurmukhi: qwgVdI qUr bwj hY jwgVdI joDw jb ju`tih ]lwgVdI lu`K ib`Qurih swgVdI sMnwh su qutih ]
transliteration: Taagadditoor Baaj Hai Jaagaddijodhaa Jab Jouttah(i)|| Laagaddilouthh Bithhurah(i) Saagaddisaaanaah Su Toutah(i)||
translation: When the warriors will confront one another, the warriors horns will be blown; the lances will break and the corpses will be scattered;

gurmukhi: BwgVdI BUq BYro pRisD Aru is`D inhwrih ]jwgVdI j`C ju`gxI jUQ jY Sbd aucwrih ]
transliteration: Bhaagaddibhoot Bhairo Prasidh Ar(u) Siddh Nihaarah(i)|| Jaagaddijachchh Judgadijtth Jai Shabad Ouchaarah(i)||
translation: The Bhairavas and ghosts will run and the adepts will see this spectacle; the Yakshas and Yoginis will hail the warriors;

gurmukhi: sMswgVdI suBt sMjm Aimt kwgVdI kRu`D jb grij hY ]dMdwgVdI ieMk durmiq ibnw AwgVdI su Aaurn brij hY ]12]239]
transliteration: Sansaagaddisoubhat Sanjam Amit Kaagaddikruddh Jab Gadaj(i) Hai|| Dandaagaddiikk Durmat(i) Binaa Aagaddisu Auran Baraj(i) Hai||12||239||
translation: When the warriors named Sanjam (Restraint) will thunder in fury, then he will not be opposed by anyone else except Durmat (evil intellect).12.239.

gurmukhi: jwgVdI jog jXvwn kwgVdI kr kRoD kVMkih ]lwgVdI lu`t Aru ku`t qwgVdI qrvwr sV`kih ]
transliteration: Jaagaddijog Jayvaan Kaagaddi Kar Krodh Kandakkah(i)|| Laagaddiloutt Ar(u) Koutt Taagadditarvaar Sadakkah(i)||
translation: When this hailing warrior yoga (union) will shout in fury, then the swords will create sensation and there will be loot and destruction;

gurmukhi: swgVdI SsqR sMnwh pwgVdI pihrhYN jvn idn ]swgVdI S`qRu Bij hYN twgVdI itik hY n ie`k iCn ]
transliteration: Saagaddishastra Sannaah Paagaddipaihar-hain Javan Din|| Saagaddishattru Bhaj(i) Hain Taagadditik(i) Hai Na Ikk Chhin||
translation: When he will hold the weapons and wear armour, on the same day all the enemies will flee away, without staying for a moment;

gurmukhi: pMpwgVdI pIAr isq brx muK swgVdI smsq isDwr hYN ]AMAwgVdI Aimt durDrK Bt jwgVdI ik jidn inhwr hYN ]13]240]
transliteration: Panpaagaddipeear Sit Baran Moukh Samast Sidhaar Hain|| Anadgaddiamitdurdharakh Bhat Jaagaddiki Jadin Nihaar Hain||13||240||
translation: With yellow faces they will run away on that day, the day on which he, unconquerable warrior will throw his glances on all.13.240.

gurmukhi: AwgVdI iek Ar cwru pwgVdI pUjw jb ku`pih ]rwgVdI ros kir jos pwgVdI pwien jb ru`pih ]
transliteration: Aagaddiik Ar Chaar(u) Paagaddipoojaa Jab Kouppah(i)|| Raagaddiros Kar(i) Jos Paagaddipaain Jab Rouppah(i)||
translation: When five evils, getting enraged and angry, will stand firmly in the flesd,

gurmukhi: swgVdI S`qRu qij AqR BwgVdI B`jih su BRm rx ]AwgVdI AYs au`jVih pwgVdI jx pvn pqR bx ]
transliteration: Saagaddishattru Taj(i) Atra Bhaagaddibhajjah(i) Su Bhram Ran|| Aagaddiais Ujjadah(i) Jan Pawan Patra Ban||
translation: Then all will run away forsaking their arms and weapons like the leaves flying away before the wind;

gurmukhi: sMswgVdI suBt sB Bij hYN qwgVdI qurMg ncwie hYN ]CMCwgVdI CqR biRiq C`if kY AwgVdI ADOgiq jwie hYN ]14]241]
transliteration: Sansaagaddisoubhat Sabh Bhajaagaddihain Taagaddituran Nachaae Hain|| Chhanchhagaddi Chhattra Brit(i) Chhadd(i) Kai Aagaddiadhaougad(i) Jaae Hain||14||241||
translation: When the warriors will cause their running horses to dance, then all the good modifications, forgetting themselves, will experience their downfall.14.241.

gurmukhi: cimr cwr chUM Er Furq suMdr Cib pwvq ]syq bsqR Aru bwj syq SsqRx Cb Cwvq ]
transliteration: Chamir Chaar Chahoon Or Dhurat Soundar Chab(i) Paavat|| Set Bastra Ar(u) Baaj Set Shastran Chhab Chhaadat||
translation: The pretty fly-whisks are swinging and the beauty of this hero is fascinating; his white garments, white horses and white weapons look splendid;

gurmukhi: Aiq piv`qR Aibkwr Acl AnKMf Akt Bt ]Aimq Ej Animt AnMq AwC`l rxw kt ]
transliteration: At(i) Pavitra Abikar Achal Ankhanndakat Bhat|| Amir Oj Anmit Anant Aachhall Ranaa Kat||
translation: He is extremely immaculate, vice-less, invariable, indivisible and invincible warrior, whose glory is infinite and who is unconquerable and never deceivable,

gurmukhi: Dr AsqR SsqR swmuih smr jidn niRpoqm grij hY ]it`ik hY iek Bt nih smr Aaur kvx qb brij hY ]15]242]
transliteration: Dhar Astra Shastra Saamuh(i) Samara Jadin Nripotam Gadaj Hai|| Tikk(i) Hai Ik Bhat Nah(i) Samara Aur Kavan Tab Baraj(i) Hai||15||242||
translation: O king ! on the day, then holding his arms and weapons, he will thunder, then no one will be able to stay before him and even obstruct him.15.242.

gurmukhi: ieik ib`idAw Aru lwj Aimt Aiq hI pRqwp rx ]BIm rUp BYro pRcMf Aim`t Adwhn ]
transliteration: Ik(i) Bikkiaa Ar(u) Laaj Amit At(i) Hiprataap Ran|| Bhim Roop Bhairo Prachanndd Amitt Adaahan||
translation: Vidya (learning) and Lajja (modesty) are also extremely glorious; they are large-bodies, powerful and indestructible;
